ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_2d package

Submodules

ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_2d.boxes module

Implements basic operations for bounding boxes.

It is usefeul to visualize the results of the Mask RCNN network and to have a class representation in the same way as the masks.

class ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_2d.boxes.Box(box: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes])[source]

Bases: object

Contains a single box.

Implements methods to process boxes and visualize data.

the box data with shape (1, 4)

Type:

np.ndarray

Initialize a single box.

Parameters:

box (np.ndarray) – the box data with shape (1, 4)

plot(ax: Axes, color: str, linewidth=3.0) → None[source]

Plot a single box using the Matplotlib library.

Parameters:

  • ax (matplotlib.pyplot.Axes) – the subplot where it’s desired to insert the box.

  • color (str) – the desired hexadecimal color for the plot.

  • linewidth (float, optional) – the box’s line width.

class ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_2d.boxes.BoxGroup(boxes: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes])[source]

ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_2d.curves module

Implements basic operations for 2D curves.

The curves are used to filter redundant masks.

class ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_2d.curves.Curve2D(x: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes] | None = None, y: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes] | None = None)[source]

x (float/np.ndarray) – the x coordinate(s) of the line.

  • y_values (np.ndarray, optional) – the y coordinates to plot using the line coefficients. If x_values or y_values are not specified, the Curve2D.x and Curve2D.y attributes are used to plot.

  • options (str, optional) – the Matplotlib color and line options (see matplotlib.pyplot.plot documentation for more details).

ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_2d.detections module

Encapsulates functions that deal with the detection of features in 2D images.

It’s only necessary to apply filtering simultaneously to the masks and boxes.

class ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_2d.detections.DetectionGroup(boxes: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], masks: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], scores: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], binary_threshold: float)[source]

Bases: object

Agroup masks and stems groups to do filtering.

boxes

the detected boxes group.

Type:

features_2d.boxes.BoxGroup

masks

the detected masks group.

Type:

features_2d.boxes.MaskGroup

scores

the inference scores.

Type:

np.ndarray

Initializes a single detection.

Parameters:

  • boxes (np.ndarray) – the masks with shape (num_boxes, 4). This is the same format outputted by the Mask RCNN network.

  • masks (np.ndarray) – the masks with shape (num_masks, color_channel, height, width). This is the same format outputted by the Mask RCNN network.

  • scores (np.ndarray) – the inference scores provided by the network. Masks and scores must be at the same corresponding order.

  • binary_threshold (float) – the threshold with the masks will be binarized. Binary masks are extensively used in this project, so this argument is mandatory.

filter_redundancy(x_coordinate_threshold: float)[source]

Filter the detections that represents the same crop.

The filtering follows these steps:

1. Finds the appropriate curves to describe each mask. For more information about how the curves are obtained, please refer to the features2d.Mask.extract_curves method documentation.

2. Finds the X coordinate where the obtained line intercepts the bottom part of the image.

3. Applies a threshold on the distance between consecutive X coordinates. Masks that have this coordinate too close are merged and their curves are calculated again.

TODO: Throw an exception when no detections are informed.

Parameters:

x_coordinate_threshold (float) – the threshold to be applied to the distances between lines’ X coordinates.

is_empty() → bool[source]

Check if the detection group is empty.

Returns:

is_empty (bool) – True if the detection group is empty, False otherwise.

metric_filtering(type: str, score_threshold: float = 0.5, percentage: float = 0.5)[source]

Filter the detection group by some metric.

It discards the masks, boxes and scores considered worst.

Parameters:

  • type (str) – the type of metric that will be used to filter the group. It can be ‘score’ or ‘percentage’. The first one will filter the group by an arbitrary score threshold value. The second will filter the group to remain only the best provided percentage of masks.

  • score_threshold (float, optional) – threshold value at interval [0, 1]. Masks with scores below this threshold are deleted.

  • percentage (float, optional) – threshold value at interval [0, 1]. It determines the percentage of best masks that are desired.

ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_2d.masks module

Implements all the functionality related to 2D masks.

class ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_2d.masks.Mask(mask: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], binary_threshold: float)[source]

_get_RANSAC_line(average_curve: Curve2D) → Line2D[source]

Fit a line to the average mask points with RANSAC.

Parameters:

average_curve (features2d.curves.Curve2D) – the curve positioned in the middle portion of the mask.

Returns:

ransac_line (features2d.curves.Line2D) – RANSAC line object.

_get_average_curve(binary_data_indxs: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]) → Curve2D[source]

Get the “average” curve from the mask.

For each unique Y coordinate from the binary mask, it averages the X coordinates.

Parameters:

binary_data_indxs (np.ndarray) – the indices where binary_data attribute is not False.

Returns:

avg_curve (features2d.curves.Curve2D) – average curve object.

extract_curves() → None[source]

Extract curves from the mask to do posterior filtering.

Storage the curves in average_curve and ransac_line attributes.

This algorithm is a two step process:

1. Gets a curve whose X coordinate points are the average X coordinates from the mask for each unique Y coordinate also in the mask.

  1. Fits a line through the ‘average points’ using RANSAC.

plot(alpha: float = 1.0) → None[source]

Plot a single mask using the Matplolib library.

Parameters:

alpha (float) – the mask transparency amount.

ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_2d.tracking module

Implements a tracker for corn crops using SORT algorithm.

SORT is a simple, online and realtime tracking algorithm for 2D multiple object tracking in video sequences. It works with bounding boxes.

class ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_2d.tracking.AgricultureSort(camera: StereoCamera, max_age=1, min_hits=3, iou_threshold=0.3)[source]

Bases: object

Modified SORT: A Simple, Online and Realtime Tracker.

camera

the camera object that contains all the stereo camera information to project 3D points back into the 2D plane.

Type:

features_3d.camera.StereoCamera

max_age

the maximum number of frames to keep alive a track without associated detections.

Type:

int

min_hits

the minimum number of associated detections before track is initialised.

Type:

int

the minimum IOU for match.

float

a list of AgricultureTracker objects.

Type:

list

Type:

int

Initialize the SORT object.

Parameters:

  • camera (features_3d.camera.StereoCamera) – the camera object that contains all stereo camera information to project 3D points back into the 2D plane.

  • max_age (int, optional) – the maximum number of frames to keep alive a track without associated detections.

  • min_hits (int, optional) – the minimum number of associated detections before track is initialised.

  • iou_threshold (float, optional) – the minimum IOU for match.

_associate_detections_to_trackers(detections: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], trackers_data: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], iou_threshold: float) → Tuple[_SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]][source]

Associates the detections to the existing trackers.

  • unmatched trackers (np.ndarray) – the unmatched trackers.

_convert_bbox_to_z(bbox: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]) → _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes][source]

Converts a bounding box in format [x1, y1, x2, y2] into [x, y, s, r].

The [x1, y1, x2, y2] is segmentation model output format for bounding boxes, where (x1, y1) describes the top-left point and (x2, y2) the bottom-right point. The [x, y, s, r] is the Kalman filter format, where (x, y) describes the bounding box center coordinates, s is the bounding box area and r is bounding box size ratio.

Parameters:

bbox – (np.ndarray): containing the crop bounding box.

Returns:

converted_data (np.ndarray) – the bouding box data converted.

_convert_x_to_bbox(x: List, score: float | None = None) → _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes][source]

Converts a bounding box in format [x, y, s, r] into [x1, y1, x2, y2].

The [x1, y1, x2, y2] is segmentation model output format for bounding boxes, where (x1, y1) describes the top-left point and (x2, y2) the bottom-right point. The [x, y, s, r] is the Kalman filter format, where (x, y) describes the bounding box center coordinates, s is the bounding box area and r is bounding box size ratio.

Parameters:

  • x (list) – containing the bounding box data.

  • score (float, optional) – containing the detection score.

Returns:

converted_data (np.ndarray) – the bouding box data converted.

count = 0

static attribute to give unique ID’s to the trackers.

Type:

int
